title: Horrible purchase!
body: Horrible purchase!!! From the time they were taken out of the package I could see a loose wire and a partially shredded loom as though they were used! Also only one ear piece works sometimes! I would like my F***ing money back!!!

title: very good
body: nice sound, good bass,  stay in the ear during workouts.  this is my second pair; lost the first.  very good.

title: They were okay while they lasted.
body: I bought these earbuds less then 6 months ago, I liked them fine, but they eventually cut out in one ear.  If you buy these, save your receipt to take advantage of the warranty.  I am buying a different brand this time.

title: this is my favorite particularly for work outs and runs
body: Out of all skullcandy products, this is my favorite particularly for work outs and runs.They don't last too long with vigorous exercises but it's what u paid for. :D

title: Next!
body: We bought this for our step-son. He was excited at first, but said the sound quality wasn't what he expected and the pads were uncomfortable.

title: Four Stars
body: Working well so far. Just wish it has sound control button!

title: Five Stars
body: Great earbuds.

title: Awesome
body: Thanks for the fast shipping and work perfect ill buy more from u soon

title: Great,for about a day
body: Worked initially but after about a day, one side would cut out. You can fiddle with them and make them work, if you are careful. Very poor quality product.

title: Great
body: I think they are really great headphones, especially for the price. The only thing is that I always want my music louder.

title: Terrible Quality
body: Within 48 hours of use, they began to crackle. Now I have to physically hold the headset plug in the phone at a particular angle to make them sound correct. Terrible quality.

title: Damaged but work
body: Bought these for my brother and when he opened it, the volume button was loose. The ear phones still work so he didn't want to return them

title: Garbage product that falls apart quickly
body: Didn't buy these from Amazon but have owned 2 pairs. First one sounded wonderful at first, but after 2 months I lost the sound on the left earbud, AND the microphone feature in the cord stopped working. Sent them back to Skullcandy and got a voucher for a replacement. The second one also sounded great, and after 2 months the sound got very staticky and intermittent due to the cord coming loose where it meets the jack. Keep in mind that I never abused these at all. Just normal usage. Absolutely garbage.

title: the best
body: THEY HAVE AN UNLIMITED WARRANTY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!very pleased with headphones and customer service great sound quality and style. will buy again

title: They were great while they worked
body: I maybe got 10 days out of these. They were great while they worked, but what is the point if they fall apart less than two weeks later? Worthless

title: Decent inexpensive headphones!
body: Decent inexpensive headphones.

title: Best bang for your buck
body: Best bang for your buck. These ear buds have pretty good sound quality and they last for 1-2 years which is really good for ear buds and they look cooooooool

title: Five Stars
body: They work great and enjoy my music. And hands free when I getting calls.

title: Broken Product within One Month of Purchase
body: These earbuds are absolutely horrible. As someone who listens to music more often than not, I'm extremely disappointed in the quality of this product. I've owned several pairs of Skullcandy earbuds in the past before, but these are by far the WORST pair I have received. After only a month of use and utmost care, the right earbud stopped producing sound. However, I continued to use them because I didn't have a replacement pair at the time. A few days ago, the jack popped off of the cord, rendering them useless. I had to throw them away after only two months of having them. Needless to say, I will not be purchasing from Skullcandy EVER again. If you want good headphones, with spectacular quality - both musically and physically - bite the bullet and spend a little more cash on a pair of Sonys or Beats. Trust me, the extra money will pay off in the long run. And to be honest, you probably already spent enough money on buying several pairs of awful earbuds to pay for a better pair.

title: Great!
body: I love the skullcandy headphones they work great!  I love black &blue color on my headphones also when some one is calling me all have to do is click on the volume clicker answer

title: Good
body: Good headphones other than the right earbud is faded a lil but good sound quality and bass... These headphones are worth it.. They been through a a lot even been through a whole cycle wash in the washer machine (left them in my jeans on accident) and still sounds like new..

title: Four Stars
body: I like this model very much. It is comfortable and has a good sound output.

title: Five Stars
body: AAAAA+++++

title: Three Stars
body: Price good but they are too bulky for my ears. Sound quality is okay....

title: Great sound, but don't buy it.
body: Okay so i m a 15 year old and music is a huge part of my life and i bought my first skull candy headphones a few years ago, and those ones ended up failing on one side. I have gone through 5 PAIRS of these headphones and every time they just stop working on one side. My dad had the same problem with his and he takes AMAZING care of his electronics. The sound is amazing and these are very comfortable but don't buy it without knowing you will have to buy one withing the next 4 months. the longest mine lasted was 3 months. So go for it if you think you can take PERFECT care of them and just know side will eventually fail.

title: I bought this earphone while ago but I remembered it ...
body: I bought this earphone while ago but I remembered it lasted less then 2 weeks. For some reasons the wire got loose and exposed everything inside it. It looked ugly and dangerous. I planned to buy this for work-out but I didn't even have a chance to go work-out with this earphone.

title: For the price, it's a great pair of earbuds that is great for ordinary use.
body: Pros:Great sound quality for an inexpensive pair of earbuds.Inline Mic and mute buttonTangle-free cordCons:It feels like a expendable pair of earbuds.The silicone covers are a little uncomfortable after a while of use

title: Great value!
body: This is my second pair of this headphone.  I accidentally ran my first through the wash.  Great sounding headphones.  This pair makes it hard to justify spending $100 or more unless you are a true audiophile.

title: Wow
body: Had another pair of skullcandy (rasta) buds and thought they were great, These blew me away what a surprise. And a great price.

title: friendly budget
body: so after 4 months, the earbud stopped working. Overal, It was a really good pair of earbud. I took really good care of this pair since i messed up my other headphone. The sound blast is awesome. However, i disappointed to see it stopped working. For this price, I did it job. R.I.P my awesome earbud

title: Good up until breaking
body: I was pretty excited about the quality of these headphones. That was until they wound up, as so many headphones do, losing one channel. Apparently a broken wire where the cable goes into the plug. Does anyone make headphones without this weakness? I thought these were the ones, but I was wrong. I can't imagine it would be that hard.

title: Sounds great!
body: They sounds great, they look great, and have a mic. Everything I expected from skull candy earbuds, so I'm happy!

title: Great sound quality
body: Great sound quality, completely portable. I wish they had the button which allowed to adjust for volume, but it's still great.

title: Great for the Price!
body: I bought these because my Toxics broke at work, and I have always been a fan of Skull candy. Now I will say they're a little "off" by saying the bass is insanely good. Though compared to a $5 pair of headphones yeah they are great. But they're really good for ear buds and you save a few bucks from say buying them at Walmart. Amazing quality; good bass. All around a good pair.

title: bummed
body: Mic and button broke within 2 days of use. I'm pretty disappointed

title: Great sound
body: Had a pair of these before for quite a while before one of them conked out on me. Great pair of earbuds

title: SIX STARS
body: The best ear buds I've ever owned.Sound quality is excellent.

title: Great product for great price.
body: Great sound for a cheap price. I love that they never get tangled due to the design. Could use volume control but thats available on other models.

title: Four Stars
body: Nice product. Good sound and a great value.

title: Good product
body: High quality yet still inexpensive earbuds. They do a good job of cancelling out ambient noise and are not overly big in or on your ears liek other noise cancelling options. Albeit they won't completely block out all ambient noise like some of the over-the-ear options, they do a more than sufficient job.

title: Holy Mother of Baby Narwhals!
body: First off, as soon as I took these out of the package I was like 'Holy Mother of Baby Narwhals These Are SWEEEEEET!!!'They look absolutely stunning, especially with the flat cable.The quality of the plastic on the ear buds isn't quite as high quality as they look in the pictures here, but they are nonetheless very nice.Also, I ordered these with amazon Prime, which normally takes two to three days. A couple hours after I ordered I got an email saying they shipped and I should be getting them in one day at around 8 at night. I got them he next day at around 4 pm. SUCH a good feeling when that happens.So lets get to it, the Pros and ConsConsI haven't had time to see how reliable they are over time so I can't say anything to the build qualityThey only come with two different sizes of the rubber parts that actually go into your ear, so if you generally feel discomfort with these types of headphones that might not be too good.Extend use (say like 5 or 6 hours) will get your ears feeling kinda soar, but again, this might depend more on how your own ears areNo volume control on the headphonesProsTHEY LOOK FREAKING AMAZINGThe flat cable feels really nice and seems to be quite durable.They have a microphone attached, and you can click it to pause the music or skip ahead, or use Siri if you have an iphone.The cable is pretty long. long enough that i can comfortably use them wearing a long jacket with my ipod in my pants pocket and the cable going on the outside and under the bottom (this sentence is kinda confusing, but i'm too lazy to rewrite it, so basically cable is really long, but not too long)Sound quality is SUPERB. They can go really loud, they cancel outside sound quite well, and the bass is simply astonishing.When I say sound quality is good, I don't just mean good for 15 dollar headphones, I mean its nearly as good as the quality of my 75 over-the-ear studioheadphones.THEY COME WITH A GREAT BLOODY WARRANTY!I'm gonna buy another pair right now, and as soon as these break or I loose them I'm buying another 5 pairsI ABSOLUTELY could not be more pleased with these headphones.

title: Broke within one week!
body: Look, these headphones look and sound good. The fit is good, and they are priced very well. However, they BROKE within 1 week of using them! I can only hear sound from the right earbud; the left is totally dead now. Terrible quality. I wish returns/exchanges weren't such a hassle. Ughhh.

title: not happy with them
body: One of the ear buds stopped working after a month. Makes it really hard to listen to anything with only one.

title: Just as advertised
body: Good quality.

title: Not really an improvement over the much better original
body: So it has a mic ... that's about the only improvement over the original. I liked the original "rope" style cords on the Paul Frank versions of the Ink'd earbuds and bought dozens of them, both as gifts and replacements for ones I'd lost. These are a shadow of those in almost every way.Pro:- Same sound quality of the original Ink'd- Has a mic- Price is still good, as alwaysCon:- The actual bud is re-shaped and is a little larger. This is bad because no matter what size rubber thingamajig you use, the size of the earbud prevents it from going deep enough into the ear to create a seal for passive noise blocking.- No tangle cord still tangles and is not as good as the rope style I mentioned before, though it is a marked improvement over the vanilla Ink'd cords that took the shape of their packaging and never got straightened out afterward.- Mic is alright, but the "multi-function" button is barely functional ... maybe it's just my older phone (original Droid Incredible), but I have no idea what the button is meant to do, unless it's meant to abruptly end all my calls when I press it.So, not a bad set of earbuds for the price, but when compared to the original Ink'd earbuds, this new and "improved" set doesn't hold up. Kind of a bummer since the company is good and it's going to be a while before there's another update to the model. I can only hope that Paul Frank or another designer will make custom versions of this new model later on down the line. In the meantime, though, just buy the originals and forget about mics.

title: It was good while it lasted
body: I purchased the Skullcandy Ink’d Earbud Headphones with Mic on March 2, 2015. When they arrived they were packaged in an impenetrable plastic barrier. After cutting them out of their prison-like casing I successfully used them for their intended purpose for about two months. During the month of May the right earbud, containing the mic, went out. One week later the other went out while I was listening to it. I did not damage the earbuds by water damage, crushing them, or general wear and tear. I will not be purchasing them again because they were not worth the money spent.

title: They broke pretty quickly. I don't know why I keep buying ...
body: They broke pretty quickly. I don't know why I keep buying skullcandy, they always break... I think cause they are so cheap I fall for it again lol

title: One Star
body: lasted a week

title: sucks
body: They broke the 2nd day

title: Three Stars
body: The headphones work okay. But nothing you couldn't buy out at the store anywhere.

title: Great Apple earbud replacement!
body: The standard Apple earbuds are too uncomfortable to wear on long trips.The Skullcandy's come with two sizes of rubber fittings, allowing you to get a comfortable fit that doesn't fall out or ache over long periods of time. Great sound, great price. Highly recommended.

title: Picture is pretty deceiving
body: Thought it would have a metallic look to it but its just made of matte light plastic. Pretty standard earphones, wish i got something more expensive now that I think about it.

title: Left outside in the rain
body: Still work beautifully after over a week outside. They were dropped on accident and found 8 days later after 2 days of heavy rain. Plugged them in and are working great. I have bought several pairs of Scull candy headphones and have not been disappointed.

title: Bad build quality
body: i have ordered two pairs of these headphones in the past two months. I am not an audiophile, so to me they sounded just fine to me. They were inexpensive and looked good, so it seemed like they were a good deal at the time(S) of purchase. However, both pairs broke within a month of usage each. Both times one of the earbuds would just give out all of a sudden. They appear to be a good deal, but i definitely would not recommend.

title: Five Stars
body: perfect

title: Don't buy
body: These ear phone suck after 1 month they died

title: Extremely poor build quality. Broke within minutes.
body: I bought one of these abroad, 6 months ago, and they are great. So I ordered this one. The package looked flimsy, the printing of the brand name was partially cut off by the cut out on the back of the package. The product design and hand feel was of low quality compared with my older unit. The "skull" on the back of each ear piece was small and not centered, or clear (again, compared with my older unit which looks great). I tried it on day one for less than a minute. The next day, trying it on, the plastic holding the right ear piece separated and was hanging by the exposed wires. I contacted Skullcandy, I was disappointed. With several emails back and forth, they first asked me for pictures. So I sent 5 (including the broken ear piece). Then they asked for the receipt, so I sent a picture of that. Then they asked me to cut the cord in two places and send more pictures back so they could decide what to do about a warranty. So I gave up. All I wanted to know is whether this is a fake product.

title: Can't beat the value
body: Got these for the gym, I couldn't be more happy. I have been trough several pairs of earbuds they either break easily or keep slipping off my ears when I'm jogging on the treadmill, these fit perfectly and have enough external sound isolation for me to workout without any distraction, will definitely buy again if they ever break but I highly doubt they will any time soon.

title: Really
body: Broke around a month of use. It was the wiring. Keep in mind, I've used these EVERY SINGLE DAY (4-8 hours) so I really put these to the test.Another con to point out. Bass is drowned out and ruins some of my heavier music. It does not take a audiophile to notice this.Although I have owned Skullcandy before (that have worked), these one's that I've bought must've been some duds. So to those who got lucky, props to you. But it feels like I got ripped off.Disappointed with the quality for the price. I've had better ear buds from Wal-Mart honestly.

title: Love the Tangle Free Cord
body: I purchased this for the wife. I own the Blue one. I purchased mine after I spent a 3 hour Plane ride unable to hear my the movie on my iPad due to all the airplane noise. On my next trip, I used my new pair and it was spectacular. My wife started using mine because she considered the iPad earbuds too uncomfortable so I purchased her a pair. I purchased them on June 13, 2013 for $10.76 and they are still working great.

title: I wanted ear buds with out the mic built in ...
body: I wanted ear buds with out the mic built in. The specs and pictures didn't not have a mic built in.  Once I received them in the mail.  Well it had a mic.

title: Five Stars
body: great quality and great tone.

title: Five Stars
body: Amazing earbuds!! They work perfectly and they arrived really quick. Worth it!

title: Good audio but cheaply made- broke in 2 weeks
body: Sound was good till the mic and headphones broke in under a month. The wire next to the audio jack must have come loose because as it moves it causes my audio to skip and the volume to change. At this point the mic only works in certain positions. Really disappointed with these headphones. The audio was good till they broke in 2 weeks.

title: Great Headphones
body: Awesome, because they are skull candy and they really block out the sound nobody but me can listen to my songs!!!

title: No volume adjustment buttons
body: It was disappointing not being able to adjust volume from the headphones, and I'm actually not sure the mic works very well, I've been avoiding using it because my girlfriend couldn't hear me when I tried using it the first time.

title: Great comfort and quality at a great price! I've stopped wasting my time and money buying MANY cheap earbuds throughout the year
body: With a young music loving son I have purchased more earbuds in the past year than I care to remember. We have cheap earbuds everywhere. The bargain basement priced ones seldom make it a week or two before the rubber tips fall off, the wires break or they get lost or destroyed.When we saw these on sale I picked up a pair. They cost a little more than the garbage that I had been previously buying but the additional expense is insignificant when I factor in how much better these are.I had heard good things about Skullcandy so I bought my son these exact earbuds hoping they'd be better than what I had been previously purchasing. They are! I've used them myself based on his recommendation.  They sound so much better and that's just the start.  They're also more comfortable and you can achieve a much better fit. These seem to block out exterior noise well and there have been no issues with the rubber tips falling off as is so common with every other set of earbuds we've had.These things have changed my approach to buying earbuds.  I had previously given up and simply treated earbuds as a disposable item since my son would sometimes go through a few pairs in a month.  Instead of deciding I'll just continually replace cheap $1-$5 earbuds 3 times a month I've decided I'll buy better ones less often like these Skullcandy Ink'd Earbuds.  As an added bonus my son actually likes these and is very careful not to misplace them or mistreat them as a result.PROS:+  Great value for the quality+  Good sound quality+  Durable+  Comfortable+  Block out exterior noise+  The rubber does NOT constantly fall off of theseCONS:- Slightly more expensive than other earbuds but you'll buy 3 to 4 pairs of those to one of these!

title: BUY THEM FROM WAL-MART
body: GREAT SOUND, GREAT FIT......best sounding earbuds for the money....but....they wont last long.  I've gone thru 4 sets of these earbuds in 3 months and I take care of my stuff....mu advise is buy these earbuds from Wal-Mart so u can take them back when they fail and they will fail....

title: they sounded great! I usually buy the Skull Candy Jib ear ...
body: I ordered these headphones at the end of May and within two weeks the right headphone went out. I only use them to chat on my ps4, so they weren't used very much. The two weeks they did work, they sounded great! I usually buy the Skull Candy Jib ear buds and I've had no problems with them.I would not recommend the ink'd 2 earbuds.

title: 16 year old neice loves these
body: A Christmas present and she was very impressed. Nice fit and the sound is "awesome". Guess that sums them up!

title: Five Stars
body: They are good quality headphones.

title: great quality, great price
body: Not an audiophile but I think the sound quality is great from these headphones. I buy one of these every ski season since I like to listen to music while snowboarding. The play/pause function from the mic is an absolute must. I can easily pause to hear my friends without removing earphones from my ears or taking phone/ipod out of my pocket. The new design and cord is nice. Would be nice if there was something to hold the wires closer together to keep the buds from tangling. so far so good!

title: One Star
body: they don't work.

title: loss of sound to left ear happens very quickly
body: When I ordered this product I ordered two pairs at once so when a year from now one of them finally broke I would have a back up (because that's how skull candy ear buds work for me). Sadly, that wasn't the case. I placed a review not too long after I ordered about how great they were, but I kind of wish I had waited longer. Overall the sound quality is pretty good initially, especially for the price, but it didn't take too long before the first pair I opened started to get lower sound quality and eventually no sound all together in the left ear, then damage to the casing holding the ear buds together, then diminished quality in the right ear as well. I had hoped that the first pair was just bad luck on my part, but the second pair I opened STARTED with the left ear not getting any sound.I really hate leaving 1 star feedback so I guess I should leave the few pros...this product did ship quickly, and despite the problems with the sound from the ear buds the microphone continues to work flawlessly. Really sorry seller, but I will NOT be recommending this product :(

title: Good product
body: More than what I expected for the price, pretty nice cheap pair of headphones.

title: Five Stars
body: Great buy! I love them!!

title: Out with the new, in with the old
body: I love the older Ink'd earbuds a lot more than the newer versions. I use Ink'd earbuds to work out with, but when I sweat with the new versions the button on the wire gets wet and affects the playback of whatever I am listening to (pausing it at random, or causing songs/entire playlists to skip). I wish the older ones had not been discontinued. The sound quality is fantastic and they usually last me over a year. I would recommend these to anybody looking for a relatively cheap, yet decent quality pair of earbuds.

title: Could have had better display pictures
body: I am an avid fan of all skullcandy products so when I saw these were cheaper than best buy I jumped at the opportunity. However, they weren't exactly the ones I originally wanted. The ones I had to replace have a basic control panel/mic hook up on the left earbuds cord. These are exactly identical in sound quality, but are missing that feature. If the images were clear I would probably not  have gotten these. Not to say these aren't a good product at all. I just look for a control feature like this when I don't have access to my phone. It's a slight inconvenience but its not an annoyance. I would recommend this product.

title: Sounds like tin cans!
body: I've been buying Skullcandy earbuds for years now and have never been as disappointed as I was with this purchase. I tried listening to music on several of my devices and the sound was just terrible. Along with the tinny sound is a constant background noise. Trying to talk to someone on the phone was just as bad. I returned these and picked up the Sony MDREX15LP/B Earbuds instead. If you don't need a mic and are more concerned with media sound, save yourself the time and do the same! There are numerous options in the same price point as these that are of much better quality.

title: Five Stars
body: The only headphones we've found that my son loves and says actually stay in his ears.

title: Cheap, cheap, CHEAP!
body: These headphones are actually really good, with great sound quality and they fit well in the ear. But the week after I bought them, they broke very quickly. First, The right earbud died, and then microphone-button also began to fall apart. It got to the point where it became nearly unusable. The build quality is just so atrocious. I wish headphones this cheap wouldn't break nearly as easily, because otherwise, they're great headphones.

title: better than $100 headphones.
body: Bought these to replace older skullcandies. These new ones have greater response and greater bass levels. Would definitely recommend these.

title: loves it
body: my daughter is the worse on headphones. these are great and seem to be very durable . i an getting a pair for myself

title: Ears hurt
body: Edge is sharp. For some people who experience discomfort and then pain for long time wear of such things, pain is a matter of time.Design is bad. Too much low frequencies too little high'sOld once were better.

title: One Star
body: No they broke when I got them

title: Good Earbuds
body: Sounds good. Fits ear comfortably. And the multiple colors makes this product interesting. What else do you want for this price?

title: It's About That Bass
body: I really like the sound that these ear buds produce. Now I hear the bass that was missing from my previous ear buds. I am happy with the quality of workmanship also. I recommend this product to others.

title: One Star
body: Sound like crap, do not buy

title: $5 earbuds were better
body: About 3 years ago I picked up a $5 pair of earbuds from the discount bin at a local bookstore. These lasted me until 6 months ago when I lost them. So I picked up a pair of these. 2 months ago one earbud went out. I endured. Tonight, the second one did. When I looked up the warranty, they want the original receipt, something I do not keep. Why the second star? Well, they did work at least for a while. I will go back to that bookstore for another $5 pair that will hopefully last me 3 years again.  Edit: lol forgot I bought these, was reviewing some old reviews and saw this. I bought those $5 ear buds and they work still. Sad that the $5 are better than these.

title: Great!
body: The earbuds are great to use. They are high quality, the mic is very useful for me daily. And I just gotta say it's fantastic and worth the price it is.

title: Two Stars
body: Good headphones but received the one without the mic

title: Great Earbuds for anyone
body: Great headphones for the price!!! I own "beats by dre tour 2.0" and they sound exactly the same great sound. A little low on the bass but for the price there all worth it... If placed in the ear right you get a pretty good noise cancellation thing going. I would tell anyone to buy these even if you had the money for more expense buds

title: All about that BASS
body: These earbuds are descent in quality in terms of their build quality. The mic and the play pause button is really cheap looking and seems to be fragile. The cable is flat as advertised and the quality is pretty good. Plus it keeps the cable tangle free for the post times. The sound quality is good for the price of these earbuds. The bass is definitely present but is really muddy. If played in full volume the bass will overpower the treble. The 3.5mm jack is gold plated. Overall I would recommend these to those people who love bass and love EDM and Dubstep categories.

title: Two Stars
body: Got the headphones and one of the speakers did not work. The guy refunded my money.

title: Five Stars
body: Fast delivery service and packaged just as described.  I'm getting what I asked for.  Thank you!

title: The Perfect Value Earbuds...if the quality were better.
body: PROS-Best Quality Sound for the Price-Excellent Base-Nice Design-Excellent FitCONS-Didn’t even last a month-Dead Earbuds are Useless EarbudsShould you buy it: NOActual Value: $2I’ve had a couple of earbuds and usually I stop using them because I simply lose them. This is the first time that the earbuds have disintegrated in front of me. Although the sound is good for the price, unless are extremely careful with them (newborn baby careful), you’re better off looking somewhere else.-Design-The design of these earbuds are nice and attractive. The flat cable design makes it hard for the cable to get untangled. The red on black color scheme looks good and the design of the earbuds themselves look profession and a level higher than what they cost. It comes with 3 ear tips which seem to fit in my ear (medium size). In design, Skullcandy takes the prize.-Performance-Audio quality is spot on. I’m not an audiophile, but my ear is good enough to tell between a $5,$10,$25,$100, and $250 headphones. That being said, these aren’t on the same level as Klipsch or Bose (Beats are a clear ripoff), but they are higher than what you expect. The bass is relatively strong and the tremble is okay. Clarity is good, although certain genres of music won’t sound all that great (Anything that isn’t Rock, Pop, Rap, or R&B). Still though, for the price, they can’t be beat easily.-Quality-Here’s where the real problem is. I usually take care of my headphones and I listen at a moderate volume across all types of genres (except metal). However, within 2 weeks the side without the microphone started to go faint until it was completely mute. The temporary solution was to just listen to the side with the microphone. However, one week later, they got caught along some plastic fence. Where most headphones would simply tug or slip off, this one decided to pull apart and rip off completely. That’s when I went to the nearest store and bought a completely different set. These will not last as long as I hope. In regards to quality and durability, there are far better options out there.-Conclusion-If the headphones had stayed and lasted for at the very least 3 months, I would’ve given them a higher rating. However, the quality of these things can’t justify the performance and looks. It is similar to buying a sports car that you know it’s unreliable. You’ll enjoy the moment and regret nothing for buying them. But sooner or later, when you needed the most, it breaks down and leaves you to be on your own. That might be a bit exaggerated, but you get the point. There are options that come fairly close to performance, but won’t break at the slightest sign of stress.I’d recommend the Sony MDREX15AP. They aren’t as good looking and look fairly generic. But the sound is more balanced than the Skullcandy and the durability is so much better. I’ve had a black pair of them for more than 8 months and they still work.ly. That’s when I went to the nearest store and bought a completely different set. These will not last as long as I hope. In regards to quality and durability, there are far better options out there.-Conclusion-If the headphones had stayed and lasted for at the very least 3 months, I would’ve given them a higher rating. However, the quality of these things can’t justify the performance and looks. It is similar to buying a sports car that you know it’s unreliable. You’ll enjoy the moment and regret nothing for buying them. But sooner or later, when you needed the most, it breaks down and leaves you to be on your own. That might be a bit exaggerated, but you get the point. There are options that come fairly close to performance, but won’t break at the slightest sign of stress.I’d recommend the Sony MDREX15AP. They aren’t as good looking and look fairly generic. But the sound is more balanced than the Skullcandy and the durability is so much better. I’ve had a black pair of them for more than 8 months and they still work.

title: Could be A LOT better
body: Functions could be better. Button only works to start Svoice (I have a galaxy s4, for my ipod it will start siri) or end a call. It will not change the song, pause the song or video, etc. Just very basic functions. As for the sound quality, this is one of those headphones where everyone around you can listen to what you're listening too, even if you don't have the volume all the way up. I had expected more from SkullCandy.

title: ... would give them 5 stars since ink'd are my favorite earbuds but i ordered 2 of these and the ...
body: under normal circumstances i would give them 5 stars since ink'd are my favorite earbuds but i ordered 2 of these and the mic came broken on both. on one the mic cover snaps off and on the other one it simply broke in half otherwise they are great

title: Good enough for Country Music.
body: Highs? Lows? Mid range nuance?Who cares. Billy Ray Cyrus sounds okay. LeAnn Rimes kicks it. Leonard Cohen growls sound as good as always.They stay in my ears when sword fighting.I keep 'em in even when I'm not listening to anything. I don't enjoy social conversation at the coffee shop all that much.And, I mean how can you not admire a product named "Skullcandy"?

title: Five Stars
body: Great !

title: Five Stars
body: They work great!!!!

title: Work wonderfully!!
body: These are really comfortable and the sound is nice. Very durable and are made well. Love them!

title: nice product good sound
body: these earbuds have a very clear sound, their base and the microphone appears to be very clear they can be used for stereo only music, video, or as I do also uses for my phone primarily.the only complaint I have is that a hat has a very high pitched little sweet, and I can't pinpoint how to get rid of it. It's possible that it may only be certain music or my ears, I do have some high pitched problem. I would not hesitate to recommend but I would tell them about that hi pitch issue, maybe no one else has it.

title: Muddy and Cheap Quality, Mic broke unexpectedly (Don't Buy)
body: The sound that comes out sounds really muddy and has a very low audio quality. It only favors lows and bass. I guess if you buy Skullcandy headphones, that is all you want. Vocals sound awful, and acoustic music is pretty bad.Also, the mid and control device on the cord of my pair broke within a month of buying them. I have no idea why. There were no cracks or any sign of damage. It must be a techincal problem. I always get techincal problems when buying Skullcandies, whether sound only comes out of one bud, or it has static after a few weeks.Don't buy these headphones.

title: These are great!
body: I like these ear buds. They offer great sound with deep bass and clear highs. The mic feature works great with the iphone 5. The best feature is the flat cord. It's flat not round. This keeps the cord from getting kinked. They also shipped fast. A must buy.

title: Worth the price
body: I have had these headphones for almost two months now, and I am still very happy with them. For the price they sound amazing, and stand up to most other headphones under $50. I use them daily, be it on my commute to work, at the gym, or out for a run, and they have help up nicely. They only real negative aspect of them are that they are not noise cancelling, or even dampening headphones. I have to turn them up pretty loud to drowned out any outside noise which, unfortunately, allows other people around you to noise from the headphones as well, but for the price they are worth it.On a side note, the headphones are be sold as bulk so they will not come in the sam packaging that you see them in the store,. However I have looked into it and they are the real deal.

title: They Fracking Broke
body: They broke in the second week. I used them three times.

title: Amazing for the price
body: Pick a pair of Dre Beats ear buds for $150 or pick these up for $15. Are the beats 10x better, no way. Would you feel 10X worse if you lost or broke $150 ear buds compared to $15 ear buds, yes.The quality of sound and comfort in your ear is significantly better than the iphone ear buds (new and old generation). The bass sounds fine as long as you dont max the volume. What I like the best is that they fit comfortably in your ear much like a soft ear plug would, effectively "cancelling" sounds in the outside world.

title: Good Sound
body: These little buds surprised me.  For the money they pack a good sound.  I would recommend them to all my friends.

The plastic has trailing edges and the flat wire feels extremely fragile. Overall, I get the impression that this is some sort of imitation than real skullcandy headphone. I bought skullcandy earbuds before and they were much better looking than what I got this time. Audio sounds OK. But NOT at all worth the $19 I spent. In comparison, the Panasonic RPHJE120R In-Ear Headphone I bought November 2012 is way better, still works, sounds good and cost me only $6 on Amazon.

title: Supreme Sound Gimmick
body: I was happy with the original version of these, but I wanted one with a microphone. So, I assumed these would be the logical upgrade. Unfortunately, this new "Supreme Sound" feature is just awful. The bass echoes for too long and the highs are harsh and piercing. It's a shame because I do like the new shielded wiring and the microphone works fine.

title: They didn't even last a full year!
body: I thought they were pretty good until the left side went out today. I will not be repurchasing, since I know in another eight months I'll just have to replace them.Pros:- They are comfortable, I could wear them for a long time without my ears hurting.- The noise cancelling was good. *See "Cons" for additional info on this.- Small enough to carry around in your bag or pocket.Cons:- They do not last long. (Nothing does anymore, it seems)- I could hear some "static", which was presumably the noise cancelling feature. My previous headphones (a different, over-the-ear brand) did not do this, and they were better at doing the job than these. After awhile I did get used to it, but sometimes it still irritated me.

title: Skullcandy Ink'd 2.0
body: I love the color combination (black/red) and the bass of the earbud.It can be fashionable, which I think it is the primary goal that it is made for.If you want crisp bright tone on your ears, then this is not the product your looking for.However, if you are in love with bass in your ears, this is the product that you want.

title: Flat mids, horribly sibilant highs. Very different soundscape from previous INK'd
body: Pros:  Great fit, improved cord, still good for the price.  The cord on the pair I recieved is flat and rubbery, not braided as described in the listing.    Cons:  Straight plug, 'Supreme Sound', require equaliser    These earphones have crisp strong bass, flat mids, and sharp highs- which is great if you like those descriptions. I dislike all three. I used to buy Skullcandy specifically because they avoided all three.  If you are familiar with the older Ink'd line, do not expect these to sound the same. The bass is punchy not boosted, the mids are weak and flat not expansive, and the highs are annoyingly piercing.  The previous Ink'd line did have muted, almost muddy highs, but over-isolating them to a painful degree is not an improvement- especially not at the expense of mids.    They CAN produce fantastic sound, which I can tweak if I have access to a decent equaliser. I buy in-ears for travel though, and my portables have terrible equalisers. I need in-ears to sound at least near my preferences out-of-the-box, and at the very least not have shrill, painful highs.     Update: burn-in does not fix highs (not that I was expecting different), but double- and triple-flanged tips from other IEMs help. Still too harsh for me without dropping EQ bands.    Two stars because while they are still great earphones for about fifteen, the highs are atrocious. You may like the new sound stage better. I will be giving mine away.
